name: Automation Station
description: [Clank]                                     [Clank]                                  [Clank]                                   Dang th...oh, it's working finally! Greetings, Bandit! I'm Machinist Meeka! My twin brother and I are the head factory engineers here! We make sure things are automated like...well...clockwork! A well oiled machine! A well choreographed mechanical dance! Come on, lets go talk more in private!

quests.name: MineFactory Reloaded
quests.description: You're here, great! Like I said, my name is Meeka. My twin brother and I are the head factory engineers here at The Ferret Business. While he focuses smaller, more powerful systems, I focus on getting things moving like clockwork.     Now, I hear talk about how your world's materials are all infused with Magic, and I've been doing some tinkering on my own with samples and...I'm already loving what I've found! I think we can come up with a better, more efficient factory.            First though, you'll need to gather some materials and the basic components...

tasks.longDescription: Bouncy Bouncy, who doesn't like rubber? Good cushion, good insulator, fun material! Scans show you have Rubber Trees around. Multiple types, in fact, but the one I know of has sort of an orangish bark and bright green leaves. Chop it down and you'll get some Raw Rubber, which you can Smelt down into Rubber Bars.

Rubber is good for insulating cables, but what we'll be using it for is making plastic. Smelt Rubber Bars down to refine them into Raw Plastic, and then you can combine four bars worth into  Plastic Sheets.

The Factory Machine Block is the heart of almost every MFR machine. Usually, a machine can only be powered with RF Energy...but the magical nature of your materials, it seems to be able to be powered by EU and MJ as well.                       Likewise, these Pipes seem to be special. When you apply a Redstone Signal to them, they can pull liquid out of a machine or tank, but when they are made of material from your world, they don't seem to melt when pumping, say...Lava. Or Molten Metal. That is amazing!

This Sledgehammer can be used to rotate MFR and other machines. A strange thing, when you are holding it, you can see the range of MFR machines...must be a magical link between all the Plastic used...

quests.name: Progressive Automation
quests.description: There are a lot of seemingly simple tasks you need to do to survive out there, isn't there? My brother and I were talking over this, and we feel the best way to help you is to teach you one of the easiest series of automations you can do. The best thing about these machines is you can Progressively upgrade them to work bigger areas and faster!

tasks.longDescription: All of these machines take some sort of Fuel to power. Sometimes, though, a large chunk of Coal is a waste to use for a single machine, so you can break it down into a Fuel Pellet to be more efficient.
You can customize your Automation machines using this wrench. By Sneak + Right Clicking it into the air, you can change modes, then Right Click a side of the machine to change what it does.

quests.name: Mining Automation
quests.description: One of the major things you'll be needing a whole lot of in automation is...well...metal! You'll need it to make the machines, conduct the electricity to power them, make things to store stuff, all that fun stuff! Well, being more or less alone, getting a lot of metal is going to be a problem, isn't it? Well, not with these! These automated miners search downward for materials it can mine, dig them up, and replace them with Cobblestone.

tasks.longDescription: Miners require a Shovel and a Pick the same level as the Miner (Wooden Miner = Wooden Tools, etc). They also require Cobblestone to replace the items with.

quests.name: Farming Automation
quests.description: Farming is a slow, tedious job. I'd much prefer poking a wrench into a machine than a shovel into the dirt, myself, but at least most of the time it tends to itself. At least until harvest time. But thankfully, I have a machine to help! You can place the planter one level under some dirt, give it a hoe and some seeds, and it'll go to work!

quests.name: Logging Automation
quests.description: These machines take lots of Fuel to run nonstop. Regular Coal is not exactly an easily renewable resource...but Charcoal is! And to make Charcoal, you need Wood, lots and lots of Wood! So, why not Automate it? The Chopper, when supplied with an Axe and some Saplings, will plant, wait, and then automatically chop down and replant trees for you!

quests.name: Breeder Automation
quests.description: Like tending crops, tending animals is a boring business. Slow but full of weird smells and tempermental creatures. But with technology, we can automate the process! By placing this in the pen with a breeding pair of animals, and supplying it with power and the proper Food (like Wheat for Cows, or Seeds for Chickens), it'll automatically get them breeding and multiplying!

quests.name: Killing Automation
quests.description: I've been told you world is full of monsterous creatures that would love to gnaw your arm off. Thankfully, I have a machine that should help you quite well! Its called a Killer machine, just give it a bit of Fuel and a weapon, and it'll attack anything that walks on top of it. Careful, this includes you!

quests.name: Crafting Automation
quests.description: Having to make all your tools and gadgets by hand must be a real pain in the tail, know what I mean? Especially things you need to make a couple hunded of! Thankfully, this machine can automate crafting things together for you. Put in the pattern for the crafting recipe on the left, some supplies on the right, and some Fuel, and watch it work!

quests.name: Energy Automation
quests.description: So, a lot of machines use RF Energy. Most of them, in fact, except for a few older model lines or some special cases. Theres a whole lot of different ways to generate RF, but perhaps the simplest and most direct way is to burn Fuel and convert it directly into RF Energy. If you place one of these next to an automated machine with an RF Engine in it, it will charge the Engine with the RF.

quests.name: Progressive Power
quests.description: Most of these machines require some sort of Fuel to run, but most technology nowadays doesn't run on an internal Furnace, you know? Instead, they run on RF! With this little RF Engine, you can put it into some sort of charger to, well, charge it up like a battery, then stick it into any of these machines instead of Coal!

quests.name: Progressive Upgrades
quests.description: Each of these machines are fantastic in their own right, but if you want to increase the size of your operations, your only choice is to make lots of every machine, right? Wrong! The better choice is to upgrade a single machine! Each upgrade only works on that specific tier of machine (So Wood Upgrade for Wood machines), and it will increase the number of blocks it works by 1 for each upgrade. So to have a machine work a 3x3 area, you'll need 8 upgrades, for example.

quests.name: Progressive Mining
quests.description: The Miner has a pair of upgrades you can install that should really help out.

tasks.longDescription: The Cobble Gen Upgrade will automatically produce Cobblestone for the Miner, but it will take more Durability from your tools and more Fuel.
The Filler Upgrade will have your miner fill in any empty air or spaces with liquids it scans over while mining.

quests.name: Progressive Killer
quests.description: The Killer can be upgraded with a Filter that will tell it to attack only specific types of creatures.

tasks.longDescription: The Mob Filter Upgrade will tell the Killer machine to attack only hostile creatures.
The Animal Filter Upgrade will tell the Killer to only attack passive creatures like Chickens or Cows.
The Adult Filter Upgrade, when used in conjunction with the Animal Filter Upgrade, will tell the machine to only attack Adult animals.
The Player Filter Upgrade will tell the Killer to only attack other sentient creatures, such as other Assistants.

quests.name: Progressive Breeder
quests.description: The Animal Farmer can tend to a whole range of different animals, some of them which can give different items. There are two upgrades to help with the Animal Farmer tending these animals.

tasks.longDescription: The Milker Upgrade will enable an Animal Farmer machine to milk cows if it is supplied with buckets.
The Shearer Upgrade enables an Animal Farmer to Shear sheep, as long as it is given a pair of Shears.

quests.name: Withered Progression
quests.description: With some research the other labs in The Ferret Business have done, we've discovered a way to harness the power of a Nether Star to vastly improve your Progressive Automation machines!

tasks.longDescription: The Wither Upgrade, when added to a machine, will multiply its range by 4!
By imbuing basic materials with Nether Stars, you can make supremely strong, nigh unbreakable tools, useable in any of these machines!

quests.name: Plastic Tools
quests.description: Now, remember how I said I was tinkering with your magical materials? Well, I decided to make some handy tools to see what would happen, and the results are quite interesting, I have to say!

tasks.longDescription: I know it seems like an odd tool, but a Straw is perfect for sampling various liquids, sometimes getting interesting effecs! Normally if the liquid was too hot, it'd melt the Straw...but not if its made of your world's Rubber...just. Just try not to drink Lava, okay? That isn't very healthy...
Plastic Bags are perfect for carrying groceries home, or anything really. You can carry up to 5 things in a Plastic Bag.
Plastic Cups act like Buckets and can pick up various liquids. The bonus is that if you can drink the liquid with a Straw, you can drink it directly out of the Plastic Cup!
This is good for viewing things at long distances. It will tell you the distance something is up to 200 blocks away.

Normally, a Ruler would only be able to tell you the distance accurately if it was under a foot...or a yard sometimes. This Ruler? Right Click it on one block, then you can go do the same on another block down the hall and it'll tell you the exact distance!

quests.name: Farming the Field
quests.description: Now, unlike the factories you may be thinking of, here in The Business, we like to automate as many steps as we possibly can in the products we make. This includes planting crops and harvesting them for various uses.                             Some of these machines will be your first introduction into real MFR Machines. Your basic MFR Machine usually has a front and a back. When you place the machine down, the front will be facing away from you. You can later rotate a machine with your Precision Sledgehammer or any machine Wrench. Keep in mind that most MFR Machines require Power as well.

tasks.longDescription: Place the planter one block below a 3x3 area of the appropriate soil. It will plant seeds and saplings in its inventory, and where you place it in the inventory is where it will plant it. If you place an Oak Sapling in the top center of the inventory, it will plant it on the North Center block.

This machine will scan a 3x3 area in front of it for crops and saplings, applying Industrial Fertilizer to them. Normally, this would just speed up the plants' growth a little bit, it seems that your world's magical materials will quite regularly grow the crops or trees with very little time or Fertilizer required.

The Planter can only plant crops. To harvest them, you will need a Harvester. This machine will scan a 3x3 area in front of it and harvest trees and crops. Each plant it harvests will generate a little Sludge, which will fill its internal tank. If the tank is full, the machine will work much slower.
Many machines like the Harvest generate Sludge as they work. You can Pipe this waste material out and into a Sludge Boiler, which will reduce it into one of a number of different materials.

Place this directly above a 3x3x1 or larger pool of water and it will automatically fish for you. Strangely, if it detects another Fisher close by, it will jam up and refuse to work properly until the other Fisher is removed.
The Fruit Picker will scan a 3x3x21 area in front of it for fruit to pick off of trees, like hanging Apples or Cocoa Beans. It will not replant them, though, you will still need a Planter for that.

quests.name: Farming the Barnyard
quests.description: Simple plants aren't the only living things we deal with here, and I don't mean our clients and shoppers. Farm animals provide many things we need, whether its meat, fur, wool, milk, or other such things.                                          These machines though...they seem to work strangely with your materials. Sometimes better, sometimes just in unexpected ways. I mean, animals from your world seem to be able to give birth to a baby in no time and all, and that baby grows up within days!

tasks.longDescription: When supplied with the appropriate food (wheat for cows, carrots for pigs, etc), it will scan a 5x5 area in front of it and breed appropriate animal pairs when possible.

Scans a 5x5 area in front of it for animals it can harvest from. For example, it can milk cows, and either send the milk out a connected Pipe, or fill a bucket if you supply it. It will shear Sheep, gather Eggs from Chickens, and even get soup from those unique fungal creatures you call Mooshrooms if you give it some Bowls!

If you've got a large barnyard full of animals giving birth at different times, it can be difficult to split off the young to a safer location. Using the Chronotyper, you can select either Adult or Young animals, and it will scan a 5x5 area in front of it for the appropriate aged animal, and then move it behind the machine.

The Grinder seems like a dark task for something to undertake, but the truth is most of us eat meat. The Grinder quickly kills creatures in a 5x5 area in front of it, picking up any useable materials from it and stores them in its inventory. It also seems to collect this...mysterous glowing green liquid. For now, we're going to call it Essence, as it seems to be the Essence of the creatures it kills...

quests.name: Advanced Animal Farming
quests.description: We can do a whole lot more with a farm full of animals than just breed and kill them. Utilizing them to help create more materials for plant farming is one way, but we can also utilize nearly the entire animal, wasting nothing, which I feel should be one of the goals of a fully functioning factory.

tasks.longDescription: The Sewer collects waste from animals that walk on the 1x1 area above it. Larger animals produce more Sewage. It will jam up if there is another Sewer close to it, unfortunately, but the upside is it seems to slowly generate Essence as well.
Supplied with Sewage from a Sewer (or if you find a dumping ground of it...), the Composter will convert it into Industrial Fertilizer.

The Slaughterhouse scans a 5x4x5 cube in front of it for creatures. It will kill them and process almost the entire thing into Liquid Meat and Pink Slime. Liquid Meat can be Piped out of any side of the machine, but Pink Slime will require special pipes, such as Fluiducts with Pneumtic Servos from Thermal Dynamics to extract.
Converts Liquid Meat into Raw Meat Ingots, and Pink Slime into Raw Meat Nuggets. These can then be cooked and consumed.

quests.name: Liquid Factor
quests.description: A factory needs to be able to work with liquid matter as well as solid objects. I mean, how else are you going to get soup into cans, soda into bottles, or jelly into jars? Most of these machines had some limited uses before, but I've found with your magical  materials, they are a bit more useful!

tasks.longDescription: Each Plastic Tank stores up to 4 buckets of liquid. When you place multiple of them next to each other horizontally, they will connect. Tanks will not connect vertically, allowing you to stack different liquids on top of each other.
You can pipe almost any liquid into the Fountain, and it will pump it onto the top of the machine. This includes Lava.
This little device is able to catch large amounts of Water or Snow in any climate but a desert. When it Rains, it will generate Water, but if its snowing, it will generate Snowballs.

Normally, this device would be able to store a single liquid and create objects that required it...but your special materials enabled me to improve it! You can now store up to 9 different liquids and automatically craft items that require those liquids. You can pipe liquids into any side, objects INTO the machine on any side, and OUT of the machine via the top or bottom.
If you are piping around a lot of different liquids, this might well be a big help. You can filter what liquids go through this, which side the exit out on when piped in.

quests.name: Creature Feature
quests.description: Being mostly on your own over there, dealing with creatures and animals can be a daunting task, I bet. Especially when you need to lead a pair of animals home to start a farm. And by lead, I of course, mean drag, coerce, bribe, shout at, and pray the animals follow you and don't get themselves killed. Well, usually thats what we'd have to do, but since we started experimenting with materials from your world, we've discovered some things that should be quite helpful!

tasks.description: It's a Net, not a Ball, Pokey
tasks.longDescription: Safari Nets are basically a magical version of those big game hunter nets you see, the ones you throw over a creature to tangle them up. Instead, though, this encapsulates them into a handheld item! There are two versions, a cheap one-use version, and a reusable version!

Jailer Nets are an even more magical version of Safari Nets. We've noticed a tendancy for animals from your world to up and vanish, especially monsters, but any creature released by a Jailer's Net will 99% of the time stick around. A Golden Jailer Net will also give the creature it releases a fancy nameplate! Spiffy!
Trying to catch a creature in a dangerous area? Use this Safari Net Launcher!

We've retooled a custom Breeder machine to consume Essence. By supplying it, along with Power, and any creature caught in a reusable Safari Net, you can create clones! You can either choose for it to spawn the same kind of creature, or exact copies of the creature you caught. Exact copies take much more Essence, though.
We've discovered a way to convert you own, well...worldly Experience into Essence. By using this and having empty Buckets in your inventory, you can convert XP into Essence for various MFR machines.

quests.name: Improved Farming
quests.description: Growing plants and animals the traditional way has worked for thousands of years, but this is the age of technology. Well, and magic, in your current world. So, to move with the times, we need to improve on older practices!

tasks.longDescription: Fertile Soil is tilled farmland that is rich in nutrients and does not need to be watered.
The Veterinary Station applies Syringes to a 5x5 area in front of it.
Health Syringes will heal creatures, while Slime Embiggening Syringes do what it says on the tin, more or less : using one on a Slime will cause it to grow larger.

Growth Syringes will instantly grow Baby animals into Adult animals. It is kind of expensive, so you can use a Zombie Syringe instead to do the same thing, but it DOES kind of have a...slight...chance of turning them into a Zombie instead.
Villagers in your world seem to be very prone to zombie attacks and zombification. Using one of these Syringes on them will turn them back, though!

quests.name: The Factory Line
quests.description: Now, I've mentioned that the Heart of MFR is the Factory Block, and the Veins are Plastic Pipes, right? Well, welcome to the Digestive System! A factory sorts, processes, utilizes, and discards waste materials constantly, just like a digestive system does.

tasks.longDescription: Conveyor Belts can move Items, Creatures, and even Assistants around! You can change their direction with a Precision Sledgehammer, which ca also be used to rotate it upward to create an Escalator. Going too slow? Right click some Glowstone Dust onto a belt. You can also color belts with Ceramic Dye. If you want to move around your belts without being dragged along, make yourself a pair of Plastic Boots!

When an item touches the Item Collector, whether it was dropped or pushed into it by a Conveyor Belt, it is picked up and placed into an adjacent inventory. The Collector will move items into the same inventory until it is full, then move to the next one. It chooses its inventory based on this order : Down, Up, North, South, West, East.

tasks.description: You Go This Way, That Way....
tasks.longDescription: Unlike the Item Collector, the Router is able to filter which side an item is pushed out of. Each color in the GUI corresponds with one side of the Machine. Items can be input into any side, but they cannot output upward, as the Item Router has the ability to pull an item off a Conveyor Belt that is on top of it, if it matches a filtered item in the GUI.

Since your world is fairly magical, and we've noticed you come across many Magical items, we decided to create a specialized Router for you. You can use this like an Item Router, but it will scan the magical Enchantments on an item, and allow you to sort that way.
This machine needs to be powered to work, but it can be configured to scan for specific creatures in front of it. It will then pull the creature and put it behind the machine.
The Mob Counter scans a 5x5x5 cube in front of it, counting how many animals, monsters, and Assistants are there. It outputs a Redstone Signal with a strength based on how many it finds.

Used to unify various types of material, for example different Silver Ores. Items need to be piped into the top, and it will convert it to the first suitable item in the Ore Dictionary. Can place the item in the GUI you'd prefer it converted into.

quests.name: Colorful and Useful
quests.description: Plastic, Metal, and Glass aren't the only things we tend to use in a factory. We use Ceramic as well, as it tends to hold color pigment very well and doesn't rub off. If we juts used straight dye, it could easily wear down and rub off, and then it'd get into the stuff we're producing. That wouldn't be very good Quality Control, would it?

tasks.longDescription: Mix Clay and Dye to make Ceramic Dye.
Can use Ceramic Dye to stain glass various colors, and make stained glass panes.
Roads are useful for designating a safe walking path in or around a factory. They also enable those who travel on them to move around as if they were on Ice, moving faster even when jumping.
These are modified Roads, adding a light to them that can be turned on with a Redstone Signal. You can also invert this function to keep them always lit.

quests.name: Magically Pink and Slimy
quests.description: You know the Slaughterhouse, and the Pink Slime it creates as a byproduct of making Liquid Meat? Yeah, well..we started doing a little testing with it, and it seems that its a concentrated bit of magic from your world. Fancy that! We got a real shock in our testing factory when an assistant accidently poured a bucket of Pink Slime onto the floor, and out popped a bouncing cube...with a face. It, unfortunately, bounced right into the Grinder pen...

tasks.longDescription: Slaughterhouses produce Pink Slime, which you can pipe out and fill Buckets with. By pouring it into the world, a Pink Slime will spawn.
Killing a Pink Slime will sometimes net you a Pink Slimeball. If you have a way of growing a Slime and making it Bigger, you could probably get a lot more Pink Slimeballs from a single Slime.
Combine a bunch of Pink Slimeballs and it forms into a Pink Slime Cube. It's not alive, thankfully, but you can then Smelt it into a Pink Slime Crystal. This should be useful for SOMETHING!

quests.name: Set and Smash
quests.description: Sometimes a factory needs to break down materials as part of the process of making something. These machines will allow you to automatically place and break materials.

tasks.longDescription: Every 20 seconds it will scan the spot right in front of it. If it's empty, it will place a block from its inventory.
Scans the area right in front of it, breaking any material it finds. It can break Obsidian, but not something like Bedrock.
Breaks things like Ores into their Mined products, like Redstone Ore into Redstone. Can simulate Fortune enchantment, but this requires Essence to be pumped into the machine.

quests.name: Lasers? Lasers!
quests.description: Okay, we've been doing some experiments with that Pink Slime, specifically the Crystals you can make. We've taken an old factory machine for drilling holes and....upgraded it. We might have combined this cool laser thing we had in storage with it as well. What we've ended up with is a super powerful Laser Drill! This baby takes a lot of power and materials, but when it is made out of your crazy magical materials, it allows us to mine areas that, before, were beyond our reach. I am talking of the areas under the indestructable Bedrock. Below that is what we call Void, which can destroy anything, but we've scanned beyond the Void and found riches...riches that the Drill can grab.

tasks.longDescription: To power the Drill itself, you'll need Laser Prechargers, up to 4 of them to be exact. They need to be placed North, South, East, and West of the main Drill, with 1 block of space in-between. Each of these requires power.

This is the main machine. It needs to have empty air between it and Bedrock or the dark Void of a world. It also needs at least one Laser Precharger set up. When it is functioning, it will fire a concentrated beam of energy straight down. Note that we tried to calculate the immense energy of this beam...but we ran out of numbers. I think it can kill even Gods if they aren't careful...

Laser Foci increases the chance of certain Ores spawning. The color of the Focus 'usually' corresponds with the color of the Ore, but not always. You'd figure Yellorium would be Yellow...but it isn't. Weird.

quests.name: Decorative Elements
quests.description: Plastic is a wonderful material. Its cheap to make, sturdy, and easily repairable and replacable. This gives us a lot of options, not only for machines, but for design and decoration. I mean, who wants to work in a drab, lifeless factory? Theres lots of ways to make things look more interesting!

tasks.longDescription: A Block of Plastic is quite simple and a little elegant. It's also a great way to store lots of Plastic.
Bricks give a really rustic feel to things, I feel, and making varying sized bricks, or bricks out of Stone, look fantastic!
Why stop at Stone and Clay? If you got factory workers who really like the cold (maybe you hired some penguins, dood!), you can make some Snow and Ice Bricks!
For a little Yin and Yang to your factories, you can use Obsidian and Glowstone Bricks.
Lapis is a pretty common gem, and it makes lovely bricks!
Plain Stone too...Gray? You can turn Stone and Gravel into a much lighter shade!
If bright constructions aren't your thing, you can also make stone and gravel like the night!

quests.name: Better Tools
quests.description: There are plenty of tools that can be made to aid in the construction and running of an efficient factory,  combined with the natural magicalness of your materials that seems to lend them a bit of an increased function to some of them. This function is not always, how could we say it....              Logical? Yeah, let's go with logical...

tasks.longDescription: You can cook up Sugar into a form of Charcoal, if you are low on normal Coal or Charcoal.

When placed, can Right Click more Vine Scaffolds onto it to automatically place them on top of the stack. The sides can be climbed like a ladder. When a Scaffold is broken, all Scaffolds above it automatically break too.

The Needlegun was originally a tool used by animal control to administer sedatives to a rampaging animal...we've taken it, and modified a bit into a defensive weapon for you. There are a lot of different types of Ammo you can use with it. Right clicking it will allow you to load Ammo, and Right Clicking it again will fire it. When the Magazine is empty, Right Clicking will eject the spent Mag and reload the same Ammo type if you have more in your inventory, otherwise it will have you manually choose a new Ammo.
Needles and Shrapnel are standard ammo. Fire ignites both creatures and wood on fire. Anvil fires an anvil at target, and can be used like a normal Anvil afterward.
Lava drops a bit of Lava on the ground, but will not catch Wood on fire. Sludge drops a bit of Sludge, causing Weakness, Wither, and Nausea. Sewage drops Sewage, causing Hunger, Slowness, and Poison.

DetCord doesn't seem to work like it does back home. The only use we've found so far is...in making this Fishing Rod.                                   Wait, be careful! Only use it in a safe area, away from important things like machines and other Assistants...it'll be kind of like Dynamite Fishing.                             Kind of...
You know those dark cages you find in dungeons that seem to create a steady stream of Monsters? Well, if you ever want to move one, use this PortaSpawner. It'll only work once, though.

quests.name: Upgraded Machines
quests.description: Further testing into the magical nature of your materials has resulted in the creation of what I call Upgrades. Many of these factory machines can take them, and each one will increase the range of the machine a certain amount! That means you can increase the range of your Farmers, or Breeders, etc! Keep in mind, though, that some machines cannot work properly if it detects another machine like it in its range.

tasks.longDescription: Cobble Upgrade actually decreases the range by 1.

quests.name: Factory Built
quests.description: There are a lot of things you can automate the creation of in a factory. Some of these things you need to do other things, such as fix up worn down tools, or create fuel for engines.                              We've also been experimenting more with your magical materials, and we've definitely improved on some of these designs! We've even found some uses for that magical Essence we discovered with the Grinder!

tasks.longDescription: Normally you'd take a broken down tool to an Anvil, apply some metal to it, and you'd get a mostly repaired tool back, but a little degraded, since you're really just patching it up. Not with the Auto Anvil. Supply it with some Essence, and it will automatically repair tools to pristine condition if you supply it with the proper repair material as well.

Normally, the Auto Brewer would be used to ferment alcoholic beverages...but we've upgraded the design a bit. Now you can use it to automatically brew magical Potions! Every row in the Auto Brewer represents a single ingredient step, starting from the top and working its way down. Usually you start with a Water Bottle, then go down the list.

I'm not sure what the original design of this machine was for, but one of our Assistants came up with something that might help you. Giving this Lava Fabricator power will allow it to slowly generate...you guessed it, Lava!
Lots of plant matter can be broken down into biological components, which we call BioFuel. The more of a single item you break down at a time, the more efficient the process is.

quests.name: Power Generation
quests.description: Up until now, you've probably been powering your factory machines with any ol' generator. Whatever works is fine, but you might be interested there are a few MFR specific generators you can take advantage of!

tasks.longDescription: Pipe Water and supply some solid Fuel (like Coal) to this machine, and it will generate super hot Steam for you.
The Steam you generated can be Piped into this machine to generate power.
This machine consumes BioFuel Piped into it, converting it into power.

quests.name: Auto Magika
quests.description: The magical nature of your world gives everyone here at The Business amazing, wonderful ideas. We all have so much to research and experiment with! I have a few enchanting things that should be of great use, and will definitely broaden the types of factories we can make!

tasks.longDescription: Records from your world are...fairly mysterious. They are old school vinyl style, but have lots of potential. This Auto Jukebox can automatically play any Record piped into it. A Redstone Pulse will turn it on or off. If you supply it with a Blank Record as well, it can make a copy.

This machine will extract a random Enchantment from any enchanted item you insert into it, placing it into a Book. It requires a Book and a bit of power to do this. Careful, as this can damage the original item.
If you need more items to Disenchant, you can use the Auto Enchanter. Supply it with some Essence and things to Enchant, it will automatically Enchant them up to level 30.

quests.name: Automated Rails
quests.description: Some of our factories are large enough that  just piping things everywhere isn't as efficient or, frankly, fun! They employ various different methods of transporting finished goods around, and one of them is Minecarts. They use specialized tracks that enable them to move inventory and even creatures in and out of Minecarts!

tasks.longDescription: Cargo Pickup Rails will move cargo from an inventory next to the track into the minecart if it has an inventory. Cargo Dropoff Rails will move items from the minecart inventory into an adjacent chest.
Places nearby creatures into a minecart when it passes over the rail, or  removes them from the minecart.

quests.name: A Loaded Factory
quests.description: Factories tend to deal with thousands, if not millions, of a single material if it is efficient and large enough. Storing things efficiently is always difficult, but we've found a solution for you. By utilizing the extra-dimensional properties of Endermen Eyes, we can do wonders with four dimensional space in a three dimensional world! How? By folding time upon itself in various ways, we can create larger pockets of space...but with some limitations, I have to say. We're still working on it...

tasks.longDescription: This machine can store only a single type of item at a time...but it can store up to 2 BILLION of that item! When you dismantle or break the machine, all its contents stay with it as well!

Your world's land and machines don't seem to keedp functioning if no one is nearby, they sort of...freeze in time. This Chunk Loader solves that. It can 'load' an area at the cost of either Liquid Fuel or RF Power, and that cost can be reduced by pumping in Liquid Ender or Essence into the machine.

quests.name: Cabled
quests.description: Redstone Dust is a fairly old way of transmitting an electrical signal. It has limitations, as it can only be placed on the floor, and a signal can only go 15 blocks before it is too weak and needs to be refreshed. This is normally known as the Redstone Signal Strength. With RedNet cable, the Signal Strength that goes into the cable is kept, and can go as many blocks as you need. This also gives us the basis for transfering not only Redstone Signals, but RF Energy as well!

tasks.longDescription: Along with transmitting Redstone Signal any distance, it also can transmit strength up to 120, if any machine outputs a signal that high. Each cable has 16 Color Channels it can be on, which can be cycled by holding a Precision Sledgehammer or any machine wrench and Right Clicking on the colored ring.

Like the Factory Blocks, your magical materials seem to improve RedNet Energy Cables. They convert some alternate power types into RF : EU and MJ specificially, and can output to EU as well, but not MJ (since it is the old predecessor to RF). It can also transmit RF at 1000 per tick.

quests.name: Programming Your Factory
quests.description: Automated conveyor belts and machines can only get you so far when you want to make a fully automated, efficient factory. To that end, you're going to need to bring a bit of computer logic into the mix. This is the Programmable RedNet Controller. It allows you to create complex Redstone Circuits that can rely on Variables and Constants to function. This is a lot of power, and somewhat more complex than I can describe just through the tablet...

tasks.longDescription: Such a complex machine requires more in-depth instruction than I can provide. You can easily make the instruction manual yourself.

item.nbt:
{pages:[0:"     Programmable
        RedNet
      Controller

Owner's Manual v1.0


WARNING: YOU MAY NEED TO ADJUST YOUR GUI SCALE SMALLER TO APPROPRIATELY USE THIS PRODUCT",1:"Congratulations on your purchase, assembly, or theft of your new Programmable RedNet Controller (PRC). This manual will attempt to guide you through its features and operations.",2:"Features

* 16 I/O points on
  each side
* 16 internal
  variables
* 6 user-defined
  circuits
* Expandable with
  LX-100, 300, 500
  expansion modules
  (sold separately)",3:"Circuits

The PRC is composed of one or more circuits. Each circuit is executed sequentially on every PRC clock cycle. Circuits are composed of inputs and outputs.",4:"Circuits

Inputs can come from I/O, variables, or constant values. Outputs can be routed to I/O, variables, or null (disconnected). These options are discussed separately.",5:"Circuits

All circuits default to No-Op when the PRC is initialized.",6:"Constants

The PRC can use constant values for its inputs. It contains 16 constants, with values 0-15 in them.",7:"I/O

Each face of the PRC can be connected to up to 16 I/O points. The front face cannot be connected, but the PRC can be rotated by using your standard sledgehammer.",8:"I/O

Each I/O point is indicated by a color, ranging from white to black as per the standard elements. I/O inputs will update on the next PRC clock cycle.",9:"Variables

The PRC contains variables that can be used by its circuits. Variables propagate between circuits on the same clock cycle; unlike the I/O delay.",10:"Null

Route outputs to Null if you do not want to use the value.",11:"GUI

The PRC GUI has four sections - from left to right they are input pins, circuit type, output pins, and circuit selection.",12:"GUI: Circuit Type

Select a circuit type from the list to change the selected circuit in the PRC to that circuit type. Use the Next and Prev buttons to change which circuit is being edited.",13:"GUI: Pin Mapping

PRC pins are connected in two parts, buffer and pin number. Buffer selects I/O and face, variables, constants, or null, as applicable. Pin chooses which I/O color, or which variable/constant.",14:"GUI: Pin Mapping

Left click advances by one, and right click reverses by one. Middle click advances by 16 when using variables or constants (one for I/O).",15:"RedNet Meter

Much like it can be used to read out values of RedNet cables, the RedNet Meter can be used to read out the state of the PRC's variables.",16:"Memory Cards

If you need to back up your PRC or copy it to another PRC, use a memory card. Using a blank card on a PRC will copy its program, and using a programmed card will write its program.",17:"Examples

The next sections cover some basic PRC scenarios. Face your PRC West with your sledgehammer before beginning. These examples assume access to some supplies (next page).",18:"Examples

You will need:
* A few dozen cables
* Several levers
* Several buttons
* Several lamps
* A daylight sensor
* A piston
* A note block
* A sledgehammer",19:"Example 1: AND gate

Connect RedNet cabling to the North face of your PRC, and place two levers and a lamp on the cable. Set the levers to Orange and Magenta with your sledgehammer.",20:"Ex 1: AND gate

Open your PRC. Set circuit one to And (2 Input). Set the input I/Os to I/O N, Orange and Magenta, and the output to I/O N, White.",21:"Ex 1: AND gate

Manipulate the levers. Watch the lamp. It will light when both levers are on and deactivate when they are turned off.",22:"Ex 2: Timer

Connect RedNet cabling to the South face of your PRC, and attach a lamp to it. Open your PRC and set circuit 2 to Wave (Square). Set the input to CNST 40. Set the output to I/O S, White.",23:"Ex 2: Timer

The lamp will blink about once per second. You can use the square wave generator for any device that requires an alternating redstone signal.",24:"Ex 2: Timer

The PRC runs at a clock rate of 20 cycles per second. Adjust the period (Pd) of the timer to make it faster or slower. Values too fast (<5 t) may not work correctly with all devices.",25:"Ex 3: Door Toggle

Connect cabling to the East face of your PRC. Attach a button to White and a piston to Orange. If you have extra parts, you may want to build a real door.",26:"Ex 3: Door Toggle

Open your PRC and set circuit 3 to a T-FlipFlop. Connect I/O E, White to both inputs, and I/O E Orange to Q. Press the button.",27:"Ex 3: Door Toggle

Note the piston extends and retracts on each button press. The T-FlipFlop samples the input value on a rising edge of CLK - if you don't care, connect both to the same input as here.",28:"Ex 4: Daylight Sensor/Variables

Connect RedNet cabling to the top of your PRC. Attach a daylight sensor to White, and a note block to Orange. Set a pleasing tone on the note block.",29:"Ex 4: Daylight Sensor/Variables

Open the PRC. Set circuit 4 to Equals, with I/O U White and CNST 3 as inputs, and the output to VARS 0. Set circuit 5 to a One-Shot Pulse, with input VARS 0 and output I/O U Orange.",30:"Ex 4: Daylight Sensor/Variables

When the sun rises and sets, the daylight sensor's output level will reach 3. As it arrives at that value, the note block will be pulsed. Use it as an alarm clock!",31:"Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Construct an "8" out of redstone lamps. It should look like this:
 XX 
X  X
X  X
 XX 
X  X
X  X
 XX 
Ensure no blocks connect the lamps.",32:"Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Starting with the top section and proceeding clockwise, connect them as follows:  cyan, purple, blue, brown, green, red, black. Red should be the top-left pair and black the center pair.",33:"Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Connect those wires to the top face of the PRC (along with the daylight sensor). Open the PRC, and set circuit 6 to Seven-Segment Encoder.",34:"Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Connect I to I/O U White, and A through G to cyan through black in order. If you have wired everything correctly, the clock will display the current daylight value.",35:"Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Note that as the daylight sensor has outputs 0-15, these are reprsented as hex characters as 0-9 and A-F.",36:"Additional Suggestions

* Try the various wave generators connected to redstone dust
* Try using the counter - PRE is the rollover target.
* Try using weighted pressure plates combined with greater/less than.",37:"Summary

Note that the examples all function independently, as the PRC has multiple circuits and can process many tasks at once. Amazing things can be accomplished using the PRC.",38:"We hope you enjoy your new Programmable RedNet Controller!"],author:"powercrystals",title:"PRC Owner's Manual"}

tasks.longDescription: Complex circuits can be saved and copied to other Controllers with this.

quests.name: RedNet Tools
quests.description: RedNet Cables and the Programmable Rednet Controller vastly improve the types of circuits you can make...and also vastly increases the steps you can mess up! To that, I have a bunch of tools you may be interested in when dealing with RedNet Cables, as well as a bonus machine that can only be fully utilized by a Programmable RedNet Controller!

tasks.longDescription: The RedNet Meter displays information when used on RedNet Cables, like Signal Strength. The RedNet Multimeter, though, is used on RedNet Energy Cables, and can also display things like power.
Can be connected to RedNet Cables to display the strength of a Redstone Signal that passes through it as a function of time.

Noteblocks made of your magic materials are very odd. They only make sounds depending on the material they are on...but we can control this function with a RedNote Block! What note it plays can be controlled by what Strength a Redstone Signal is that hits it. It is also the only machine I know of that can detect Signal Strength above 15, which can only be obtained via a Programmable RedNet Controller and RedNet Cables.

quests.name: Controller Upgrades
quests.description: A new RedNet Controller has limited circuits and variables it can hold. You can increase these by installing Logic Expansion Cards! There are three levels of Expansions, and each one can be stacked 3 times in a Controller.

quests.name: Rockets!
quests.description: Here's a little special thing for you we came up with. We know how dangerous your world is, so we wanted to help you defend yourself. The scanner says some of the things you face are quite big and dangerous, and we have an answer to them : The SPAMR Rocket Launcher! This is a very destructive weapon, so be careful! If you aim it at a target for a short time, it'll lock on, and certain rocket types will track the locked-on target when you fire them.

tasks.longDescription: Self-Propelled Rockets fire only in a straight line.
Uses the Lock On feature of the SPAMR to home in on a target.

quests.name: A Little Fun
quests.description: Hey, did you ever make a Potato Cannon when you were a kid? You know, some PVC pipe, an end cap, an igniter, a bit of hairspray, and a properly sized spud?                       What, really?! Well, you can make one now as well! The bonus is you don't really need hairspray, with your magical materials. Or a lighter. And the potatos might hurt a little more than before...
